name: Qualitative Analysis
description: This course surveys various qualitative methods sociologists use. Students gain insight into the craft of sociology through reading examples of the different qualitative methods, discussing the theories behind the methods, and by conducting hands-on research exercises. The objective of this course is to learn to evaluate qualitative sociological work and to know how to design and conduct a qualitative research project. [24L, 12T]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/231H5, 221H5, 0.5 SOC credit at the 200 level
